Deborah-Ann Vanessa Hughes and Pall Hardarson, doctoral candidates at Yale University, were married on Thursday afternoon in the school's Dwight Chapel in New Haven. The Rev. Carl Sharon, a Lutheran pastor, performed the ceremony.
Ms. Hughes, who is 27 and is keeping her name, is working toward a joint Ph.D. in African-American and American studies. Mr. Hardarson, 30, is seeking a Ph.D. in economics.
The bride graduated from Yale, from which she also received a master's degree in African-American studies. In 1989, she was a Fulbright Scholar in Georgetown, Guyana.

Ms. Hughes is a daughter of Euston Hughes of Brooklyn and the late Cicely Yvonne Allick Hughes. The bride's father is a dental technician in Astoria, Queens. Her mother was a pediatric intensive-care nurse at the Downstate Medical Center in Brooklyn.

The bridegroom graduated from Macalester College and received his master's degree in economics from Yale. He is a son of Hordur Einarsson and Steinunn Yngvadottir of Reykjavik, Iceland. The bridegroom's father, a lawyer, was the publisher of Dagbladid-Visir, a daily newspaper in Reykjavik.
